author: Tommy Efreeti

text: I don't think I've listened to a bad album from Nujabes. All of them are amazing! But if I had to choose my personal favorite, it would be Metamorphical Music. That album was one of my favorites as an adolescent (and still is).
author: Steven Matthews

text:
Something incredible about this song: The main piano theme is composed with a 3-beat pattern, while the drums in the background follow a 2-beat pattern. It kind of sounds awkward at first, but then forms a soothing 6-beat pattern, with an air of being incomplete... 
On a side note, that blend of instruments completely blows my mind.

author: RoyalGreenTea

text: I uploaded a couple tracks from Nujabes a few months ago, but I just had to upload this one too as it's been in my personal relaxing playlist for a while (and so I can add it to the Relaxin' playlist on YT). I love when the sax comes in. The album of the same name was released posthumously as Nujabes died in the middle of producing it, with many of his friends/artists deciding to complete it. One of my favorite albums.
author: SupraDarky

text: RIP, great musician, he left us something to remember him by. Never forgotten
author: LegendSeeker

text:
I'd never heard of this artist! Thanks for sharing. The piano work is beautiful. 

Supradarky have you ever heard of Aivi Tran? She's a pianist who loves video game music and composes some of her own. This piece reminds me of her style. Her YouTube channel is Waltzforluma.

P.S. Love your channel because you introduce me to so many new things!
